Author: “Handala Hack”
Description: Pro-Palestinian threat actors calling themselves “Handala Hack” claim to have accessed 740GB of data from the messaging app Viber, including source code – Viber denies the breach but is investigating – Users are advised to change passwords.

Author: ShinyHunters and MajorNelson
Description: Two threat actors (ShinyHunters and MajorNelson) put on sale 71 million records allegedly stolen from AT&T in 2021. However the company claims the data did not originate from its systems. Approximately one month later AT&T confirms the breach adding that the real number of impacted users is 51 million.

Target: Russian systems involved in the presidential elections
Description: Roskomnadzor, the Russian watchdog agency records a “significant number” of DDoS attacks on the Russian systems involved in the presidential elections.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: MediaWorks, a company based in New Zealand, says it is investigating an alleged security incident after a hacker claimed to have stolen the data of just over 2.4 million people and began targeting individuals for extortion payments.

Author: Earth Krahang
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover sophisticated campaign attributed to a Chinese Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group known as 'Earth Krahang' breaching 70 organizations and targeted at least 116 across 45 countries, exploiting CVE-2023-32315 and CVE-2022-21587 to gain initial access.

Author: Destroyer2009
Description: Electronic Arts has postpones the North American finals of the Apex Legends Global Series (ALGS) after a threat actor with the moniker 'Destroyer2009' compromised players mid-match during the tournament.

Researchers from Perception Point discover PhantomBlu, a malicious email campaign targeting hundreds of Microsoft Office users in US-based organizations to deliver NetSupport RAT, a remote access trojan that evades detection, partially by showing up as legitimate software.

Author: Russia?
Description: Researchers from Sentinel One discover AcidPour, a new variant of the data wiping malware called AcidRain, targeting Viasat immediately before the Russian invasion of Ukraine, specifically designed for targeting Linux x86 devices.
The city government of Pensacola, Florida, is dealing with widespread phone outages due to a cyberattack announced over the weekend.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Threat actors hijack the official contact email for the Belgian SPA Grand Prix event and use it to lure fans to a fake website promising a €50 gift voucher.
The South China Athletic Association (SCAA) is investigating a leak of members’ personal data after an alleged hack that affected around 70,000 data subjects.

Author: Medusa
Description: Henry County is hit with a Medusa ransomware attack
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) warns that scammers are impersonating its employees to steal thousands of dollars from Americans.

Author: LockBit
Description: Crinetics Pharmaceuticals, a Nasdaq-listed pharmaceutical development company, says it is investigating a cybersecurity incident following claims from the LockBit ransomware gang that data was stolen.

Author: Jasmin
Description: Researchers at Trend Micro discover threat actors deploying the Jasmin ransomware exploiting the TeamCity JetBrains CVE-2024-1798 and CVE-2024-1799 vulnerabilities.
Researchers at Trend Micro discover threat actors deploying a variant of the open-source XMRig cryptocurrency-mining malware to vulnerable TeamCity servers.
Researchers at Trend Micro discover threat actors deploying the SparkRAT backdoor to vulnerable TeamCity servers.
Researchers at Trend Micro discover threat actors deploying Cobalt Strike beacons to vulnerable TeamCity servers.
The Pokémon Company says it detected hacking attempts against some of its users and reset those user account passwords.

Author: Kimsuky
Description: Researchers from Securonix discover DEEP#GOSU, an elaborate multi-stage attack campaign likely associated with the North Korean Kimsuky group.

Author: UAC-0006
Target: Various organizations in Ukraine, including financial institutions and government organizations
Description: Researchers from Ukraine’s major state cyber agency (SSSCIP) and Palo Alto Networks identify 23 Smokeloader campaigns from a Russian threat actor, aimed at various targets in Ukraine, including financial institutions and government organizations.

Author: Fluffy Wolf
Description: Researchers from Bi.Zone discover a campaign targeting at least 140 organizations in Russia with multiple malware payloads including Meta Stealer.
Radiant Logistics, an international freight technology company, says it has cut off a portion of its business in Canada after a cyberattack.

Author: UAC-0165 a.k.a. Solntsepek (subgroup of Sandworm)
Description: The Russian threat actors from UAC-0165 disrupts the network of Misto-TV, a local ISP in Ukraine and claims to have obtained the client database and internal documentation.
Trezor's X (formerly Twitter) account is hijacked by cryptocurrency scammers via a bogus Calendly invite.

Author: Radar and ALPHV/BlackCat
Description: The Long Island Plastic Surgical Group (LIPSG) suffers a ransomware attack from the ALPHV/BlackCat and Radar groups

Researchers from SlashNext discover a new attack called "Conversation Overflow" where threat actors use cloaked emails to deceive machine learning detectors, enabling the infiltration of malicious content into enterprise networks.

Author: Narwhal Spider (a.k.a. TA544, Storm-0302)
Description: Researchers from BlueVoyant discover 'Naur Legal', a campaign targeting a diverse array of organizations by exploiting the inherent trust associated with legal services.

Author: Iran-linked group
Target: Shimon Peres Negev Nuclear Research Center
Description: An Iran-linked group claims to have breached the computer network of the Shimon Peres Negev Nuclear Research Center and to have stolen and published thousands of documents — including PDFs, emails, and PowerPoint slides.
Researchers from ESET record a considerable increase in AceCryptor attacks, with detections tripling between the first and second halves of 2023.
Researchers from Microsoft warn of new and sophisticated tax phishing scams targeting taxpayers, impersonating trusted sources and use urgency tactics to steal personal and financial data.

Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign where threat actors are attempting to compromise Social Security numbers with a tax phishing attack targeting small business owners and self-employed filers offering a link to apply for the necessary federal employee identification number (EIN).
Researchers from Imperva discover a new version of the Sysrv botnet exploiting Google sites to deliver the XMRig Miner.
Attack: Multiple vulnerabilities including CVE-2017-9805, CVE-2023-22527, CVE-2021-26084

Author: LockBit
Description: The City of Jacksonville Beach is hit with a LockBit ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Police in Romania and Spain takes down a sophisticated cyber-fraud gang that tricked victims out of millions of dollars through fake ads and business email compromise (BEC) scams.

Author: Medusa
Description: The American Renal Associates (now known as Innovative Renal Care) is hit with a Medusa ransomware attack.
Researchers from Sucuri discover a previously unknown malware campaign called Sign1, infecting over 39,000 websites over the past six months, causing visitors to see unwanted redirects and popup ads.

Researchers from Secureworks warn of a campaign using fake obituaries, created via AI, and designed to make money for their creators by redirecting visitors to adult entertainment sites and initiating antivirus (AV) popups.

Author: UNC5174 (a.k.a. Uteus) and UNC302
Target: Organizations in the academic, NGO, and government sectors specifically in the United States, Canada, Southeast Asia, Hong Kong, and the United Kingdom
Description: Researchers from Mandiant discover two groups allegedly connected to the People's Republic of China exploiting two popular vulnerabilities on ScreenConnect and F5 to attack U.S. defense contractors, U.K. government entities and institutions in Asia.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: TA450 (a.k.a MuddyWater)
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new campaign carried out by the Iranian threat actor TA450 targeting organizations in Israel.

Security researchers release a proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2023-48788, a critical vulnerability in Fortinet's FortiClient Enterprise Management Server (EMS) software, which is now actively exploited in attacks. Few days later CISA adds the vulnerability to its KEV (Known Exploited Vulnerability) Catalog.

Author: Kimsuky a.k.a. Black Banshee,Thallium
Description: Researchers from Rapid7 discover a new campaign launched by the Korean threat actor Kimsuky.

Author: UAC-0165 a.k.a. Solntsepek (subgroup of Sandworm)
Description: The Russian threat actors from UAC-0165 disrupts the network of KIM, a local ISP in Ukraine and claims to have obtained the client database and internal documentation.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Tarrant County Appraisal District suffers a ransomware attack. Approximately two weeks later the Medusa ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack,
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from AhnLab discover a StealC and Vidar malware campaign masquerading as an installer and distributed widely through platforms like Discord, GitHub, and Dropbox.

Author: Turla
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal that the Russia-linked threat actor known as Turla infected several systems belonging to an unnamed European non-governmental organization (NGO) in order to deploy a backdoor called TinyTurla-NG (TTNG).

Target: Over a hundred organizations across the United States and Europe
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a new large-scale StrelaStealer malware campaign, impacting over a hundred organizations across the United States and Europe, attempting to steal email account credentials.
Monmouth College discloses a ransomware attack.

Author: APT29 (a.k.a. Midnight Blizzard, NOBELIUM, Cozy Bear)
Description: Researchers from Mandiant discover a campaign since late February, where threat actors from APT29 used a new backdoor variant publicly tracked as WINELOADER to target German political parties with a CDU-themed lure.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: UAC-0165 a.k.a. Solntsepek (subgroup of Sandworm)
Description: The Russian threat actors from UAC-0165 disrupts the network of Triacom, a local ISP in Ukraine and claims to have obtained the client database and internal documentation.

Author: UAC-0165 a.k.a. Solntsepek (subgroup of Sandworm)
Description: The Russian threat actors from UAC-0165 disrupts the network of Linktelecom, a local ISP in Ukraine and claims to have obtained the client database and internal documentation.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Target: Retail organizations in the Middle East
Description: Researchers from Resecurity observe a significant increase in fraudulent activities and scams during the month of Ramadan, coinciding with a surge in retail and online transactions.

Customers of bankrupt crypto platform BlockFi are targeted with a very convincing phishing email impersonating the platform, asking them to connect their wallet to complete the withdrawal of remaining funds.
Emergency Medical Services Authority (EMSA) says, it identified suspicious activity in its IT network and is mailing letters to patients whose information may have been involved.
Real-world asset liquidity provider Curio suffers a smart contract exploit resulting in a $16 million loss.
Researchers from Threatdown discover a malvertising campaign delivering the Rhadamanthys stealer via a new malware named Go loader.

Researchers from Checkmarx discover a campaign infecting multiple python developers, including a maintainer of Top.gg, with information-stealing malware after downloading a malicious clone of Colorama, a highly popular tool.

A new SEO Poisoning campaign exploits Google's new AI-powered 'Search Generative Experience' algorithms to recommend scam sites that redirect visitors to unwanted Chrome extensions, fake iPhone giveaways, browser spam subscriptions, and tech support scams.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2021-44529 Ivanti Endpoint Manager Cloud Service Appliance (EPM CSA) Vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2019-7256 Nice Linear eMerge E3-Series OS Command Injection Vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
The city of St. Cloud says it discovered a ransomware attack affecting city services.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Sekoia discover Tycoon 2FA Phishing-as-a-Service (PhaaS), a new Adversary-in-The-Middle (AiTM) phishing kit allegedly used by multiple threat actors to carry out widespread attacks.

The Communications Workers Union (CWU), which represents hundreds of thousands of employees in sectors across the UK economy including tech and telecoms, is currently working to mitigate a cyberattack.

Target: Department of State employees and annuitants
Description: The State Department’s oversight office warns current and former employees to be cautious of a fraudulent scheme targeting workers’ payroll accounts.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: A threat actor claims responsibility for a data breach to Giant Tiger and leaks 2.8 million customer records on a forum.
Researchers from Kaspersky issue a cautionary alert regarding the proliferation of fake online deals for the popular weight-loss drug Ozempic.

Decentralized finance aggregator ParaSwap rectifies a critical vulnerability in its smart contract, after the exploitation of the vulnerability resulted in minimal losses of $24,000 before white hat hackers intervened.
The Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong warns against entities operating under the name "HKCEXP" and "EDY" saying the names falsely poses as an SFC-registered entities.

Author: APT40
Target: New Zealand's e Parliamentary Counsel Office and Parliamentary Service
Description: The government of New Zealand reveals that the Parliamentary Counsel Office and the Parliamentary Service in 2021, suffered a cyber attack from the PRC state-sponsored group known as APT40.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Agenda a.k.a. Qilin, Water Galura
Description: Researchers at Trend Micro discover a new Rust variant of the Agenda ransomware, propagating to vCenters and ESXi via a custom PowerShell script.
Researchers at Trustwave discover new phishing campaign leveraging a novel loader malware to deliver the Agent Tesla information stealer and keylogger.

Author: Threat actors from China
Description: Researchers at ReversingLabs identify "SqzrFramework480", a .NET dynamic link library (DLL) allegedly pertaining to Bozhon Precision Industry Technology, that may be hiding industrial espionage malware.

Author: Agenda a.k.a. Qilin, Water Galura
Description: The Big Issue, a street newspaper in the United Kingdom famed for providing homeless people with a legitimate income by paying them as vendors to distribute the magazine, confirms being impacted by a cyber incident, following the company being listed on the Qilin ransomware gang’s darknet extortion site.

Researchers at Oligo discover a new campaign dubbed "ShadowRay", targeting CVE-2023-48022, an unpatched vulnerability in Ray, a popular open-source AI framework, to hijack computing power and leak sensitive data from thousands of companies.
Researchers at Black Lotus discover a new variant of "TheMoon" malware botnet infecting thousands of outdated small office and home office (SOHO) routers and IoT devices in 88 countries.

Author: Stately Taurus (a.k.a. Mustang Panda, BRONZE PRESIDENT, Red Delta, LuminousMoth, Earth Preta and Camaro Dragon)
Target: Organizations in Myanmar, the Philippines, Japan and Singapore
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a campaign carried out by the Chinese threat actor Stately Taurus, targeting organizations involved in the ASEAN-Australia Special Summit via two specific malware strains.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Unspecified Chinese APT group
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a campaign carried out by an unspecified Chinese threat actor, targeting an ASEAN-affiliated entity.

Target: Banking users in Italy, Poland, and Sweden
Description: Researchers from Morphisec reveal that the banking trojan known as Mispadu has expanded its focus beyond Latin America (LATAM) and Spanish-speaking individuals to target users in Italy, Poland, and Sweden.
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2023-24955 Microsoft SharePoint Server Code Injection Vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
The government of Gilmer County in Georgia posts a notice on its website warning that a ransomware attack was affecting its ability to provide services to its more than 30,000 residents.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Several Apple customers report being targeted in elaborate phishing attacks via ‘MFA Bombing’, which involve what appears to be a bug in Apple’s password reset feature.
The Munchables blockchain-based game is attacked, with about $62 million worth of cryptocurrency was stolen from the game. Few hours after the attacker agrees to return the stolen funds.

Author: Kimsuky
Description: Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign from the Kimsuky group distributing the Endoor backdoor disguised as an installer from a Korean public institution.
Researchers from Human discover PROXYLIB, a campaign carried out via several malicious Android apps turning mobile devices into residential proxies (RESIPs) for other threat actors.

Author: APT29?
Description: Cisco warns customers of password-spraying attacks targeting Remote Access VPN services configured on Cisco Secure Firewall devices. THis technique could have been exploited by the Brutus botbet with overlaps with activity from AP29
VNDirect, one of Vietnam's largest brokerages, begins the process of restoring its systems after a cyberattack that forced it to suspend trading transactions.

Researchers from Netcraft reveal the details of 'Darcula', a Chinese-language Phishing-as-a-Service platform targeting organizations in 100+ countries with sophisticated techniques, such as Message and RCS smishing attacks, using more than 20,000 phishing domains.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Target: Taxpayers in multiple countries including the U.S. and the U.K.
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover multiple instances of tax-related phishing scams targeting taxpayers, using QR code schemes, bogus refunds and AI imposters.
Researchers from Cyble discover a tax-themed campaign distributing the WarzoneRAT (Avemaria), resurfacing following the FBI's dismantling of its malware operation and seizure of infrastructure.

Target: Indian government agencies and the country’s energy industry
Description: Researchers from EclecticIQ uncover Operation FlightNight, a new espionage campaign targeting Indian government agencies and the country’s energy industry with a modified version of an open-source information stealer called HackBrowserData that can collect browser login credentials, cookies and history.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Pakistan National Database and Registration Authority (Nadra)
Description: An investigation reveals that personal information of more than 2.7 million Pakistanis has been “stolen” from the records of the National Database and Registration Authority (Nadra) office, a government-run body that regulates the database of citizens.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: American retailer Hot Topic discloses that two waves of credential stuffing attacks in November exposed affected customers' personal information and partial payment data.
The Python Package Index (PyPI) temporarily suspends user registration and the creation of new projects to deal with an ongoing malware campaign.

A threat actor steals about $11.6 million from Prisma Finance, a popular decentralized finance (DeFi) platform. Shortly after the attacker declares to be a "white hat" and available to return the funds.
Researchers from Kaspersky discover a Linux version of the DinodasRAT (a.k.a. Xdealer)

Author: PhantomCore
Description: Researchers from F.A.C.C.T. discover PhantomCore, a new cyber-espionage group with links to Ukraine that has been operating since at least January of this year with a remote access tool called PhantomRAT exploiting the CVE-2023-38831 WinRAR vulnerability.

Author: IO threat actor linked to Yevgeniy Prigozhin
Target: Audiences in Europe, the U.S., Ukraine and inside Russia
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that Russian influence operations linked to the notorious leader of the Wagner Group mercenary troops, Yevgeniy Prigozhin, remain active months after his death, still trying to promote pro-Russia narratives in the U.S., including those about domestic politics and elections, the Russian invasion of Ukraine, and the Israel-Hamas conflict.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Red Hat warns that a malicious backdoor found in the widely used data compression software library xz may be present in instances of Fedora Linux 40 and the Fedora Rawhide developer distribution.

Target: Multiple gaming websites (Battlenet, Activision, Elite PVPers, UnknownCheats, Phantom Overlay, BLOG, RN, ACD, AA, EO, Iniuria, Gamesense)
Description: An infostealer malware campaign has collected more than 5 million of logins from users of various gaming websites, including players that use cheats, pay-to-cheat services.
Researchers from JAMF discover a campaign targeting Mac users searching for Arc Browser on search engines like Google to deliver the Atomic Stealer malware.
Researchers from JAMF discover a campaign targeting Mac users delvering a malware resembling the Rust-based Realst, in disguise of a fake Meethub application,

Author: AK-47
Description: Atraf, a popular Israeli LGBTQ dating app, suffers a major data breach exposing personal information of over half a million users after a threat actor with the moniker "AK-47" dumps its database on Breach Forums.

Researchers from Fox-IT discover a new version of the Vultur banking trojan for Android that includes more advanced remote control capabilities and an improved evasion mechanism. The malware is delivered through a hybrid attack that relies on smishing and phone calls that trick the targets into installing a version of the malware that masquerades as the McAfee Security app.
The Traverse City Area Public Schools (TCAPS) remains close for a network disruption due to a possible cyber attack.

Author: Sanggiero and IntelBoker
Description: Data belonging to more than 1.3 million customers of the PandaBuy online shopping platform is leaked, allegedly after two threat actors exploited multiple vulnerabilities to breach systems.

Within hours of opposition leader Alexey Navalny’s death, a group of anti-Kremlin hackers deface the website of a prison contractor’s website, and also appear to have stolen a database containing information on hundreds of thousands of Russian prisoners and their relatives and contacts.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
